item.description: stephde @ ifi.uio.no +47 22 85 24 10 Institutt for informatikk, UiO

DILUTE: Fluid Service Abstraction for Large-Scale Cloud IoT Systems This project address the question of geo-distributed resources management and service placement in the context of fog computing. More resources on the official webpage: here A Distributed Federation for LoRaWAN : FLIP This work aims to propose a collaborative platform for LoRaWAN actors. Backward compatibility with any deployed Class A end-device Free roaming inside the federation Cheap entry price: 1 Raspberry Pi Participating clusters in various European cities More resources in the official repository: here.

Journals Simplifying CPS Application Development through Fine-grained, Automatic Timeout Predictions with Stefanos Peros, Sam Michiels, Wouter Joosen and Danny Hughes at ACM Transactions on Internet of Things [to appear] Chimera: A low-power reconfigurable platform for Internet of Things with Emekcan Aras, Fan Yang, Wouter Joosen and Danny Hughes at ACM Transactions on Internet of Things [submitted] Security Issues in V2X Communication Systems with Takahito Yoshizawa, Dave Singelée, Jan Tobias Mühlberg and Bart Preneel at ACM Computing Surveys

Academic Service I’m actually involved in the co-organization of the 5th ASF GDR Winter school in distributed systems as well as co-chair for the M4IoT workshop (2020,2019,2018,2017) collocated with ACM/IFIP/USENIX Middleware conference. I’m currently serving as a reviewer for IEEE International Conference on Distributed Computing Systems, ACM SIGCOMM Computer Communication Review and IEEE Transactions on Dependable and Secure Computing. I previously served in the Technical Program Committee for DFSD (2020, 2019) as well as Shadow PC member for Eurosys (2019, 2018).
